str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
Come hither, come, hither, an exclamatory word. From deuro and an imperative form of eimi; come hither!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Masculine Plural
str2: (lit: I speak well of) I bless; pass: I am blessed. From a compound of eu and logos; to speak well of, i.e. to bless.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From kataballo; a deposition, i.e. Founding; figuratively, conception.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
